brandHighlight.data: MARTINI & ROSSI® captures the spark that set two men on a lifelong quest to make their stamp on Italian culture. Alessandro Martini - a spirited entrepreneur with a global vision - and Luigi Rossi - a creative muse whose botanical fragrances would lure noses along Turin’s Via Dora Grossa... The year was 1863 when their newfound partnership was manifested in their first vermouth: The MARTINI & ROSSI® Rosso. This original blend remains the same to this day.

description.data: Martini & Rossi Prosecco Sparkling Wine is a dry, aromatic Italian sparkling wine made from the Glera grapes that grow in the lush, sun-drenched foothills of the Veneto and Friuli regions of north-eastern Italy. Ripened in this ideal climate, they give this Prosecco wine a stimulating fragrance. Delightful over ice, it is the perfect complement to brunch or as an aperitivo and is ideal as a gift.

tastingNotesText.data: Martini & Rossi® Prosecco Sparkling Wine encapsulates the subtle, natural hints of apple, banana, peach and thyme to produce a dry, fresh and crisply aromatic sparkling wine which is a favorite worldwide. Since 2009, an appellation has protected the integrity of the Prosecco wine region. Only wines made from grapes in its prized vineyards can claim its hallowed name. Martini & Rossi® Prosecco Sparkling Wine is one of only a few coveted ambassadors of this world-renowned Italian sparking wine.

brandHighlight.data:
For over 25 years, Siduri has specialized in producing cool-climate Pinot Noir from five major appellations along the West Coast, spanning from the Willamette Valley in Oregon, down to California’s Santa Barbara County. Their goal is to produce Pinot Noir that best captures the distinct flavor and character of a given vineyard site. To that end, they specialize in Pinot Noir and source only from vineyards that provide exceptional fruit. Siduri’s philosophy is that wine should be a pleasure to drink and that serious wine and serious fun aren’t mutually exclusive.
  
Siduri, named for the Babylonian goddess of wine, is the result of our founders, Adam Lee and Dianna Novy’s, mutual love of Pinot Noir, and their dream that they could make great wines of their own. They spent years working at small, family-owned wineries and using any and all free time learning everything they could about growing grapes and making wine. In 1994, they released the inaugural vintage of Siduri to critical acclaim. Today, Siduri’s breadth and depth of Pinot Noirs is truly unique. We specialize in cool-climate Pinot Noir, producing single-vineyard designate wines from over twenty exceptional vineyard sites stretching from California’s Santa Barbara County to the Oregon’s Willamette Valley. Our winemaking goal is to produce wine that best captures the distinct flavor and character of a given vineyard site. Whenever possible we let the wine make itself. We do not want to do anything to the wine that isn’t absolutely necessary. We believe in bottling our wines un-filtered and un-fined. In the vast majority of cases we have been able to achieve this, with only a handful being filtered, and none of the Pinot Noirs being fined. We avoid these techniques as we believe they have the potential to strip a wine of its flavor. We believe that the best Pinot Noirs express their origins. But perhaps most importantly, we believe that wine should be a pleasure, that serious wine and serious fun aren’t mutually exclusive. So in our drive to make great Pinot Noir, we ultimately hope for something relatively simple—good wine to be enjoyed with good friends, good family and good food.

description.data: The key to our Russian River Valley Pinot Noir is in the diversity of sources. This sounds odd, given that the wine comes entirely from within the Russian River Valley AVA, but this region is large and possesses a myriad of soils, exposures, and unique terroirs that together produce a superb representation of the whole of the Russian River Valley. This Pinot Noir offering showcases this area in all its complexity while also making for a red wine that is imminently drinkable upon release. This deep red wine features aromas of bright red fruit, nutmeg, and fresh-cut cedar, and flavors of raspberry, black cherry, walnut, and fungi. Ripe flavors, mature tannins and impeccable balance. Pair with grilled sausages, roast chicken, sun-dried tomato pasta and lamb sliders. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled California pinot noir is 14.5% alcohol by volume. One 375ml bottle is equivalent to 2.5 glasses of wine.

tastingNotesText.data: This deep red wine features aromas of bright red fruit, nutmeg, and fresh-cut cedar, and flavors of raspberry, black cherry, walnut, and fungi. Ripe flavors, mature tannins and impeccable balance.

brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 1999, Copain expresses the philosophy that wine enhances the good things in life and is best when shared with friends and family. Copain produces wines from cool climate vineyards located in Anderson Valley, Yorkville Highlands and the Sonoma Coast that are lively and energetic, with bright, fresh flavors that have become Copain’s signature. The winery is committed to regenerative farming to enhance the health of the vineyards and sustainable winemaking practices that conserve resources and allow each vineyard and region to shine through.
  
Copain, meaning ‘friend’ or ‘buddy’ in French, embodies our philosophy that wine enhances the good things in life, and is an experience best shared with friends and family. Perched on a hillside overlooking the bucolic Russian River Valley, Copain specializes in vineyard designate Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Syrah.

Founded in 1999, Copain has built a reputation of producing food friendly, balanced and expressive wines in the ‘light-and-bright’ style. Sourced from sustainable vineyard sites in Anderson Valley, Mendocino County and Monterey County, the portfolio consists of three distinct collections—the Tous Ensemble wines, the Les Voisins wines, and the single vineyard designate wines.

Our style has long been inspired by the restrained and elegant wines of France’s Rhône Valley. The grapes are picked early to impart vibrant acidity and the wine undergoes minimum manipulation in the cellar. Coaxing lively, energetic wines with bright, fresh flavors has become Copain’s signature.

description.data: Tous Ensemble comes from the French word meaning “all together.” Copain's Tous Ensemble collection creates approachable wines that are perfect for every occasion, every palate, and every day of the week. An explosive entry and a plush finish make this red wine perfect for early term drinking. While very much in line with the complex Syrahs in our range, this wine is the gateway to our Rhône red wines. Softer, friendlier yet elegant and vivacious. On the nose, hints of lavender, graham cracker, pie crust and blackberry. As this red wine opens up, forward flavors of blueberry, anise and black cherry. On the palate the wine is bright, and plush. Pair with a charcuturie board: cured meats, soft cheeses and smoked cheeses, dried figs.  This bottled California syrah is 13.2% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: On the nose, hints of lavender, graham cracker, pie crust and blackberry. As this red wine opens up, forward flavors of blueberry, anise and black cherry. On the palate the wine is bright, and plush.

description.data: Chateau Smith Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine stays true to old-world winemaking techniques with award-winning taste. Opening with vibrant scents of black fruits such as currant and dark plum, this red blend is full on the palate with fine tannins that lend support. Crafted with premium wine grapes from the Washington State region, each bottle of wine is ready to drink without delay. Charles Smith Wines puts extreme care and detail into each wine, utilizing the unique characters of the Washington State appellation and sustainable wine practices. The star of this red wine blend is cabernet sauvignon which gives each sip intense flavor, depth and complexity, with petit verdot and cabernet franc playing delectable supporting roles. Those focused, savory notes make this wine the perfect table side companion for rich dishes like beef bourguignon or lamb chops with balsamic reduction. It's also just as tasty on its own. That taste is so out of this world, it took home 90 points from the Wine Enthusiast in 2017. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 Charles Smith Wines, Prosser, WA

description.data: From an exciting sustainable wine collaboration between musician Dave Matthews and winemaker Sean McKenzie, The Dreaming Tree Rose Wine offers beautiful rhythm of aromas and flavors, resulting in a versatile blush wine with delicate floral and tropical notes. This fruity California wine is crisp and fresh on the palate and features nectarine, strawberry, and watermelon flavors. Slowly fermented in stainless steel tanks with aromatic yeast strains for three months, this dry rose wine is a harmonious blend of pinot noir, grenache, pinot grigio, and other varietals. In a convenient screw-top bottle that is a quarter pound lighter than typical wine bottles, making it easier to recycle, this bottled rose is ready to take to backyard gatherings and share with friends. Pair this light wine with asparagus or grilled chicken salad, bruschetta, or a berry tart, or enjoy a glass of wine on its own. To keep its flavor singing, refrigerate this bottle of wine for two to two and a half hours before serving chilled. A Certified California Sustainable Winegrowing winery, The Dreaming Tree wine captures the spirit of California's wine country. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 The Dreaming Tree, Geyserville, CA

description.data: Spoken Barrel Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine is a bold and complex red blend with flavors of blackberry and cherry. This cabernet sauvignon wine starts with lush, classic aromas of cherry, black currant, dark chocolate and roasted oak and finishes with a toasty vanilla flavor and fine, velvety tannins. Hailing from the rugged growing conditions of the Columbia Valley region, this Washington State wine contains 78% cabernet sauvignon, 13% syrah, 4% petit verdot and 5% merlot. Sourced from top vineyards, the grapes in this red wine blend are destemmed and fermented warm on the skins in stainless steel tanks to extract rich flavors, colors and tannins. Deep ruby in color, this red table wine is best stored at room temperature. Chill this bottle of wine for 30 to 60 minutes before serving cool, around 60 degrees. Spoken Barrel's high-quality wines are easy to pick out, open up and share with confidence. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 Spoken Barrel, Prosser, WA

description.data: From an exciting sustainable wine collaboration between musician Dave Matthews and winemaker Sean McKenzie, The Dreaming Tree Crush Red Blend Red Wine is a tasty, complex red wine blend featuring a symphony of fruit flavors and aromas. This dark red wine is made with hand-selected fruit from varietals such as merlot, petite sirah, zinfandel, tannat, and others, each bringing something different and unique to the wine. Aged for 17 months in oak barrels, this delicious red wine offers juicy red fruit notes with nice mid-palate weight, pops of raspberry jam, notes of smoky berry, and aromas of vanilla and mocha. With its long, soft finish, this red wine is a favorite for enjoying with friends or as a complement to a nice meal. Pair this full-bodied aged wine with vegetarian stuffed poblano peppers, pulled pork, or Vietnamese-style pork sandwiches, or enjoy a glass of wine on its own. To keep its flavors singing, store this 750 mL bottle of wine at room temperature, then chill it for 30 to 60 minutes before serving. description.data: Stashed in brandy barrels for 75 days, Cooper and Thief Brandy Barrel-Aged Pinot Noir Red Wine forges a new wine direction. This dry red wine opens with an aromatic bouquet of bright, red fruit perfectly blended with spice from the brandy barrel. Refined yet rebellious, the bold flavor profile of this dark red wine sets it apart. This California pinot noir bestows caramel and allspice notes with deep, lush flavor. Perfectly ripe Rainier cherries and spice mélange dance across the tongue, leading to a warm, oaky finish. To craft this savory wine, specially selected lots of pinot noir, sourced from premium grapes grown throughout California's esteemed vineyards, undergo oak aging in used brandy casks. Complex, smooth, and well-rounded, this bold California wine is ideal for serving with steak and poultry, featuring at a wine and cheese party, or enjoying as a nightcap. To release the full flavor of this delicious red wine, store this 750 mL bottle of wine at room temperature, but chill it for 20 minutes before serving. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 Cooper & Thief Cellarmasters, Acampo, CA

description.data: Robert Mondavi Winery To Kalon Reserve Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2013 Red Wine embodies intensity, muscle, and concentration. Flavors of fresh blackberry, wild berry compote, cassis, and dark cocoa powder dance on the tongue, while notes of forest floor, allspice, and sweet vanilla provide complexity. This Napa Valley red wine blend contains cabernet sauvignon, cabernet franc, and petite verdot grapes, all hand-harvested from To Kalon Vineyard in west Oakville. The unique geography and climate of this California wine region produce delicious grapes that give this Robert Mondavi wine its distinctive character and intense fruit flavor. This cabernet sauvignon wine undergoes 34 days of grape-skin-to-juice contact to maximize the extraction of varietal character while keeping the tannins fleshy and supple. Malolactic fermentation in French oak barrels ensures seamless integration of fruit and oak in this delicious red wine. Pair a glass of this Napa Valley cabernet sauvignon with your favorite pork, beef, steak, lamb, or pasta dishes. For optimal taste, store this bottle of wine at room temperature, but refrigerate for about 30 to 60 minutes before serving cool. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 Robert Mondavi Winery, Oakville, CA

description.data: My Favorite Neighbor Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine features layered aromas of red cherry, currant, and raspberry along with wild herbs, violets, and just a hint of toasted marshmallow. This full-bodied California wine offers a generous palate of ripe plum, fig compote, and black cherry flavors complemented by notes of medium-roast coffee and creme brûlée. Made with a distinctly defined, shared vision and with grapes sourced from exceptional vineyards in San Luis Obispo County, this cabernet wine is honest and obsessive, much like the meticulous farmers who dedicate themselves to the land where these grapes grow. This world-class California red wine, crafted without any shortcuts or compromises, is the result of collaboration with these farmers and their crews, who have become favorite neighbors. Aged for 20 months in French oak barrels, this cabernet sauvignon wine has a lengthy, mineral finish characterized by a hefty structure and luxurious, silky tannins. Enjoy a glass of wine on its own, or pair this bottled wine with backyard BBQ and grilled vegetables in the company of friends who also may be your favorite neighbors! For best taste, store this 1.5 liter bottle of wine at room temperature, but chill it for about 30 minutes before serving. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 Booker Vineyards, www.myfavoriteneighbor.com

tastingNotesText.data: Delicious red wine with aromas of red cherry, currant, raspberry, wild herbs, violets, and toasted marshmallow. Aged wine with ripe plum, fig compote, and black cherry flavors. Balanced, full-bodied cabernet sauvignon with silky tannins and a long, mineral finish.

description.data: Sinfully delicious, The Velvet Devil Merlot Red Wine is a fresh, vivid, and appealing merlot wine. Opening with aromas of black fruit, cedar, tobacco, and cassis, this full bodied red wine blend has grown in popularity due to its unique characteristics, specific to Washington state wines. This delicious red grape wine's floral overtones and polished core of currant combine beautifully with its full body and pure velvet finish. This alcoholic beverage's fresh, vivid flavor and rich color result from an artful blend of 89% merlot, 10% cabernet sauvignon, and 1% malbec grapes. Pair this Washington wine with pork, steak, and bacon cheeseburgers, or enjoy a glass of wine on its own. For optimal flavor of this red blend, store this bottle of wine at room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving at around 60 degrees. description.data: Boom Boom! Syrah Red Wine is a mouth filling, rich and totally satisfying red wine blend. Explosive aromas of blackberry, boysenberry, white pepper and savory herbs dance on the nose. Its complexity and tannins are inferior to none. This red blend contains a strong helping of syrah, with a supporting cast of viognier and grenache wine grapes sourced from the Washington State winegrowing region using sustainable wine practices. This appellation is the second-largest premium wine producer in the United States and continues to grow in popularity thanks to its unique characteristics. A glass of this spicy syrah wine pairs well with lamb cutlets, slow-roasted pork tenderloin, saucy barbecue ribs or lamb meatballs. Store this bottle of wine at room temperature. When you're ready to pour a glass, make sure to refrigerate for about 30 to 60 minutes beforehand. Serve cool for optimal taste. description.data: Blindfold White Blend White Wine is a unique spin on blended wine, combining interesting rhone and aromatic varietals that nicely complement a classic chardonnay wine base. A luscious entry of toasted hazelnut and mandarin is balanced by bright acidity and minerality, along with inviting aromas of lychee, stone fruit, citrus, apple pie and peach. The finish is bright, rich and creamy with flavors of lemon zest and caramelized sugar. The Prisoner Wine Company takes an unconventional approach to winemaking by working with impassioned growers to source varietals from vineyards and appellations across California. The resulting wines are interesting blends with distinct quality and character. This Blindfold California white wine sources chenin blanc from a vineyard in Mendocino, while its grenache blanc, roussanne and viognier originate from growers in Santa Barbara. Pair this bottle of wine with chicken, seafood or salad, and serve chilled at about 50 degrees for optimal taste. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 The Prisoner Wine Company, Oakville, CA

Gently crafted from grapes grown in coastal vineyards, this California white wine blends chardonnay that provides elegance and finesse, with pinot noir that adds structure and complexity. Using the traditional French winemaking process Methode Champenoise, this varietal blend transforms from still to sparkling wine entirely inside the bottle, resulting in a crisp white wine with a slight yeastiness and fresh minerality. Refrigerate this sparkling white wine for at least three hours, and serve chilled for best test and quality. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 Meiomi Wines, Acampo, CA

description.data: SAVED Magic Maker Rose Wine is the result of a collaboration between artist Scott Campbell and winemaker Clay Brock, representing the freedom and sanctuary through fearless wine blends. This bottle of dry rose wine opens with alluring aromas of light red fruit and rhubarb, accented by a hint of thyme and grapefruit zest. This California wine is crafted with grenache, syrah, pinot noir, sangiovese, and zinfandel grapes from vineyards located as far south as Santa Maria Valley and as far north as King City in Monterey County. Perfected by oak aging in French casks, each parcel is handled separately. Through this distinct, delicate process, each batch maintains a fruity balance, giving this blush wine a crisp and bone-dry mouthfeel with flavors of grapefruit, ripe strawberry, and honeydew. A balanced acidity and long, generous finish make this refreshing blush wine perfect for pairing with pasta, salads, chicken, or seafood dishes. For the best taste, chill this wine for at least two hours prior to pouring. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 SAVED Wines, Templeton CA

description.data: From an exciting sustainable wine collaboration between musician Dave Matthews and winemaker Sean McKenzie, The Dreaming Tree Chardonnay White Wine hits all the right notes, perfectly capturing the big-fruit flavors of California's Central Coast. This chardonnay wine is made with grapes carefully harvested at night and in the morning to preserve their flavor before being aged for eight months in a combination of oak barrels and stainless steel tanks. The result is an elegant and crisp white wine with hints of citrus flavors along with nectarine, baked apple, marshmallow, spice, and toasted oak notes. A rich and fruity wine with a well-balanced, medium body, this California chardonnay is the perfect complement to most any meal. Pair this Central Coast wine with roasted chicken, grilled seafood, goat and ricotta cheese, mushroom pizza, or arugula salad, or enjoy a glass of wine on its own. To keep its flavor singing, refrigerate this bottle of wine for two to two and a half hours before serving chilled. A Certified California Sustainable Winegrowing winery, The Dreaming Tree wine captures the spirit of California's wine country. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 The Dreaming Tree, Geyserville, CA

description.data: Meiomi Methode Champenoise Brut Rose Sparkling Wine is a richly layered and expressive blush wine that opens with delicate aromas of strawberry, tangerine, and floral notes. Each glass of wine offers mouthwatering flavors of cherry, strawberry, lemon, flaky biscuit, and fine mousse. Made with chardonnay and pinot noir grapes grown in California's coastal vineyards, this sparkling pink wine goes through primary fermentation in steel tanks, followed by Methode Champenoise secondary fermentation, and finally by 18+ months of lees aging (tirage). The result is a California wine with a crisp and fresh palate and a subtly sweet finish. This silky rose wine pairs well with risotto, feta cheese, grilled salmon, and chocolate-covered strawberries. For best taste, refrigerate this dry wine for two to two and a half hours, then serve chilled at around 45 to 50 degrees. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2021 Meiomi Wines, Acampo, CA

Crafted with an unlikely mix of zinfandel, cabernet sauvignon, petite sirah, syrah, and charbono, this dark red wine blend features enticing aromas of Bing cherry, dark chocolate, clove, and roasted fig. Available in a conveniently portable, 1.5 liter wine box with BPA-free liner that holds the equivalent of two 750 mL wine bottles – or 10 glasses of wine – this delicious chardonnay wine can go where glass cannot, so it's perfect for sharing with family and friends. description.data: From an exciting sustainable wine collaboration between musician Dave Matthews and winemaker Sean McKenzie, The Dreaming Tree Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine offers beautiful rhythm of aromas and flavors, resulting in an aromatic red wine with lots of character. With classic aromas of blackberry, plum, and cassis wrapped in rich flavors of toasted caramel and dark chocolate, this delicious red wine is ready for your dinner table. Aged for 18 months in oak barrels, this red wine features cabernet sauvignon, malbec, merlot, tannat, and petit verdot grapes harvested from Chile. This harvesting and aging process creates a harmonious red wine blend with well-preserved flavors and aromas. Each sip of this aged red wine offers tannins that lend well to its elegant and supple structure. Pair this red blend wine with grilled flank steak or grilled onion burgers for a beautiful duet, or enjoy a glass of wine on its own. To keep this cabernet sauvignon's flavors singing, store this 750 mL bottle of wine at room temperature, then chill it for 30 minutes before serving. A Certified California Sustainable Winegrowing winery, The Dreaming Tree winery captures the spirit of California's wine country. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 The Dreaming Tree, Geyserville, CA

description.data: Ruffino Alauda Toscana IGT Red Wine is an elegant, full-bodied red wine blend that showcases Ruffino Wine's artisan approach to winemaking. Intense aromas of ripe red fruit emanate from this red blend wine, while subtle, yet complex secondary aromas of balsamic and vanilla add character. Made with hand-harvested cabernet franc, merlot, and colorino grapes from low-yielding vines grown in the Ruffino's Poggio Casciano and Montemasso estate vineyards, this red wine blend is rich with flavors of plum, cherry, and ripe berry, complemented by unique notes of balsamic and dark chocolate. The final varietal blend is aged first in small wine barrels, called barriques, then in steel tanks, and finally in the bottle, giving this Italian red wine sweet spice flavors along with soft tannins that linger in the palate. Pair this sophisticated Tuscan wine with peppered cheeses and savory dishes like Bistecca alla Fiorentina, tortellini with duck sauce, or risotto with sausage and lamb shoulder, or enjoy a glass of wine on its own. For best taste and quality, store this 750 mL bottle of wine at room temperature, but chill it for 30 to 60 minutes before serving at 60 degrees. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2021 Ruffino Import Company, Rutherford, CA

description.data: Aged in bourbon whiskey barrels for three months, Cooper and Thief Bourbon Barrel Aged Red Blend Red Wine has rich flavor with a long, lingering finish. Merlot, syrah, zinfandel, petite sirah, and cabernet sauvignon collide in one bourbon barrel to create this dark and jammy red blend wine that features bourbon-inspired flavors and aromas. This dark red wine garners its unique flavor from grape varietals found all across California's prime winegrowing regions. Crafted by Cellarmaster Jeff Kasavan, this California red wine bestows aromatic hints of fruit and toasty vanilla. Bourbon barrel aging gives this wine a soft, velvety mouthfeel with a subtle heat. With spicy sensations and hints of leather and nutmeg, this Italian wine blends sangiovese, merlot and cabernet sauvignon grapes from the Lodola Nuova Estate in the Montepulciano area. Enjoy this fine wine with richly flavored dishes such as roasted game, braised lamb with rosemary, veal marsala, cassoulet, seared duck breast, or a famed Florentine steak. description.data: Ruffino Rosso Toscana IGT Italian Red Wine is a well-balanced, full-bodied, red blend wine with a pleasant freshness. An elegant red blend sourced from the most prestigious winegrowing regions of Tuscany, this fine wine artfully combines the refinement of Tuscan winemaking with a modern, fruit-driven style. description.data: 7 Moons Rose Wine celebrates the phases of the moon by combining seven enticing flavors into a blush wine with bright acidity and a smooth finish, so it's perfect for any occasion. This light-bodied pink wine offers strawberry, white peach, grapefruit, rose petal, honeydew, nectarine, and watermelon flavors. Serve this bright, crisp, easy-to-drink California wine with grilled-chicken salad, bruschetta, or a berry tart. Or enjoy a glass of wine on its own; simply unscrew this 750 mL bottle of 7 Moons Wine, pour a glass, and discover the bright side of 7 Moons. Chill this bottle of wine in the refrigerator for at least two hours before serving at approximately 50 degrees. When the moonlight hits, slow down, relax, and recharge with 7 Moons. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 7 Moons Wine Co., Geyserville, CA

description.data: Crafters Union Rose Wine is made for travel, and the canned wine design allows for quick chilling on even the most sweltering days. This canned rose is crisp and fresh on the palate and – best of all – may be enjoyed as is. No glass? No problem! Each sip of this blush wine delivers enticing aromas of fresh-cut flowers, strawberries, watermelon, and white peaches, all in the uncommon style and convenience of a canned wine. Crafted in the sunny region of Madera, California, this portable wine pairs well with a fresh salad and tangy goat cheese, making it perfect for a backyard party or a picnic in the park. Each 375 mL wine can contains two and a half glasses of pink wine, which is half the amount in a standard 750 mL wine bottle. This delicate blush wine's flavor is best when the wine cans are chilled for two to two and a half hours before serving. Grab some friends, grab a bag, and – of course – grab some cans of Crafters Union Rose Wine. Enjoy something refreshing and unconventional. Crafters Union: Crafters of the Uncommon. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2022 Crafters Union, Madera, CA

tastingNotesText.data: This canned pink wine offers aromas of fresh-cut flowers for a drink that's delicate yet enticing. Canned drink with vibrant watermelon, white peach, and strawberry flavors. Rose wine with a delicious taste and a refreshingly crisp finish.

description.data: Meiomi Dry Rose Wine is a richly layered and expressive blush wine that opens to delicate aromas of watermelon, orange peel, and subtle hints of rose petal. Each glass of wine offers mouthwatering flavors of strawberry, cranberry, watermelon, and a touch of honey. Made with pinot noir grapes from the exceptional maritime regions of Monterrey, Sonoma, and Santa Barbara, this California wine goes through the traditional press and saignee methods followed by cold fermentation in stainless steel tanks, creating a light and flavorful palate that delivers a lush mouthfeel, bright acidity, and a cool minerality on the finish. This silky rose wine complements chicken dishes, roasted beet salad, soft and creamy cheeses, fruit and vegetable dips, and halibut fish tacos. For best taste, serve chilled at around 50 degrees. description.data: Meiomi Pinot Noir Red Wine offers unique structure and depth seldom seen in a pinot noir wine. This California wine is carefully crafted with premium grapes from the coastal state's most notable winegrowing regions and aged in French oak barrels, culminating in a beautifully integrated blend that allows the characteristics to enhance and build on each other. The silky texture and balanced acidity of this California red wine make it a perfect tabletop companion to thin crust pizza, so enjoy a glass of wine with your favorite slice. Serve this pinot noir at your next get-together for an evocative and memorable impression. For optimal enjoyment of this delicious red wine, serve chilled at 55 to 58 degrees. namePublicLong.data: Girl & Dragon 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon, California, 750ml

description.data: Crafted for those not faint of heart, the Girl and Dragon Cabernet Sauvignon is bold and powerful. Aromas of oak spice are followed with robust flavors of black plum, vanilla, and dark fruit, followed by a silky dark chocolate finish. The Cabernet Sauvignon grapes for this wine are sourced from only the most premium California vineyards.

namePublicLong.data: Tamarack Cellars 2012 Sagemoor Vineyards Reserve Red Blend, Columbia Valley 750ml

description.data: Founded in 1998, Tamarack Cellars strives to be the picture of excellence, sourcing grapes from the most renowned vineyards in Washington State and handcrafting our wines barrel by barrel. This Tamarack Cellars Sagemoor Vineyards Reserve offers aromas of cherrywood smoke, cranberry and rhubarb molasses lead into a floral note on the palate with flavors of raspberry vinaigrette, balsamic reduction, dark chocolate and dried blueberries. This wine has a long, focused finish with brawny tannins.

On the palate flavors of pomegranate, black cherry and roasted mushroom mingle into a lingering finish.

namePublicLong.data: Gouguenheim 2019 Mr. Dry Malbec Rosé , Argentina, 750ml

description.data: Patricio Gouguenheim started the Gouguenheim Winery in 2002 when he found his dream winery in Tupungato, an old property with great views of the Andes mountains. Today the winery is known for making world class, high-quality, site-focused wines. The sweet malbec rosé has a very light salmon rosé color with a touch of malbec. Flavors of strawberry, red berry, and cherries.

namePublicLong.data: Buried Cane 2018 Chardonnay, Columbia Valley, 750ml

description.data: Buried Cane is named for the time-honored Washington State grape-growing practice used to protect grape vines from frigid winter temperatures. Low-growing vines are buried under the soil for protection from the cold. After winter passes, the canes are unearthed, ready to supply us with another season of their treasures. Aromas of apple and pear on the nose, followed by notes of white tea, vanilla bean and crème brûlée. The ripe fruit flavors carry into the palate along with a hint of lemon and butterscotch. This wine is sleek and full, with a long, lingering finish that is balanced with fresh acidity.

text.data: Aromas of apple, pear and creamy crème brulee
Vibrant fruit flavors with distinct white peach and apricot
Pairs well with seafood, chicken and soft cheeses

namePublicLong.data: Clos Pegase 2019 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa Valley, 750ml

description.data: Clos Pegase is renowned for its handcrafted collection of award-winning wines, sourced exclusively from their 410 acres of estate vineyards. The Clos Pegase Napa Valley Estate Cabernet Sauvignon releases lush aromatics of blackberries, blueberries and coconut. As the wine breaths, more subtle notes of cedar, dried herbs and espresso bean begin to emerge. Rich and bold on the palate, the tannins drive the finish, balanced by a core of dark fruit. The acid sits on the back of the palate, coming through towards the finish, helping the flavors evolve, as the pleasure of sipping continues.  Tenma vineyard, on an alluvial fan in Jericho Canyon in northeastern Calistoga, produces Cabernet Sauvignon wines of deep color and intensity.

text.data: Aromas of cassis, antique wood, cigar box, and black currants
Rich and bold with tannins that drive the finish
Sourced from the estate Tenma Vineyard in Napa Valley
Aged 9 months in 35% new French oak
Pair with roasted meats and sharp cheeses

namePublicLong.data: B.R. Cohn 2018 Olive Hill Cabernet Sauvignon, Sonoma Valley, 750ml

description.data: Founded by Bruce Cohn, who previously was a rock and roll manager, B.R. Cohn has been hand-crafting premium Sonoma Valley wines since 1984. This Cabernet Sauvignon is sustainably farmed and produced from a blend of our best hillside blocks on Olive Hill Estate. A ripe and masculine Cabernet Sauvignon, with generous amounts of black fruit, cassis and espresso with dark earthy undertones of forest floor and briar. An enticing bouquet of cigar box, cloves and cedar all wrapped with subtle hints of mocha and anise leading to a rich palate of warm caramel, complex yet firm tannins and a long lasting finish.

text.data: Flavors of black fruit, cassis and expresso with dark earthy undertones
An enticing bouquet of cigar box, cloves and cedar
Made from the all estate fruit sourced from the Olive Hill Estate Vineyard in Sonoma Valley
Fantastic paired with grilled rib-eye with a black peppercorn and sage rub, tandoori lamb and spiced mango chutney, or mesquite grilled pork chop.
100% Cabernet Sauvignon

namePublicLong.data: Growers Guild 2019 Red Blend, Columbia Valley, 750ml

description.data: Growers Guild celebrates the longtime relationship between our winery and its early vineyard partners, many of whom we have worked with for over two decades. Aromas of red cherry and blackberry on the nose with notes of leather, charred peppers, and light roast coffee. On the palate there are subtle notes of toast and vanilla, hints of raspberry, cigar box and a kiss of dark chocolate on the finish. This wine is balanced with nice acidity, soft tannins, and a good mouthfeel. We recommend opening this wine now and enjoying it at a young age; however, this will age well for 4-6 years when properly cellared.

text.data: Cherry compote, plum, cedar and vanilla flavors
A blend of 62% Merlot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 1% each Cabernet Franc, Malbec, and Syrah
Blend of two distinct vineyards in Columbia Valley
Pairs with roasted meats, red sauces and sharp cheeses

namePublicLong.data: Clayhouse 2019 Adobe Red Blend, Paso Robles, 750ml

description.data: Clayhouse wines are an ode to the original Clayhouse which can be found nestled in a canyon up a winding dirt road in Paso Robles, where oak trees proudly stand guard and rows of wine grapes trellis up the hillside. This Adobe Red Blend offers dark black cherry, brambly blackberry vanilla, and cocoa aromas. Soft juicy black fruit and leather flavors combine in the mouth in this complex blend of fruit flavors. Tannins are soft with a vanilla-laced finish.

text.data: Dark cherry, brambly blackberry and vanilla aromas
Juicy on the palate with black fruit, leather and round tannins
Aged in American, French and Hungarian Oak

namePublicLong.data: Corvidae 2019 Rook Merlot, Columbia Valley, 750ml

description.data: The Corvidae Rook Merlot delivers flavors of blueberry, dark red fruit, and hints of grilled meat that finish with vibrant acidity and a long finish. Corvidae works with affordable fruit, sourced from Washington’s Yakima Valley,  and handcraft it into excellent wine. The crow family, including blue jays, magpies and ravens, are amongst the most brilliant and quick-witted birds, and adorn our labels to honor the intellect that is involved in our winemaking process.

text.data: Flavors of blueberry and dark red fruit ending with a vibrant finish
100% Merlot
Sourced from premium vineyards in Washington State

namePublicLong.data: Gouguenheim 2020 Malbec, Argentina, 750ml

description.data: Patricio Gouguenheim started the Gouguenheim Winery in 2002 when he found his dream winery in Tupungato, an old property with great views of the Andes mountains. Today the winery is known for making world class, high-quality, site-focused wines. The estaciones malbec is dark red in color with violet hues. Rich and strong aromas of plums, black cherry and licorice lead to a juicy, fruit-driven, rounded wine.

text.data: Full bodied with soft tannins and a long finish

namePublicLong.data: Qupe 2018 Grenache, Santa Barbara County, 750ml

description.data: In contrast to the Old World, Qupé focuses on cool climate expressions of Rhône varietals due to a distinctive geographical feature that sets them apart from most other regions of California. This Grenache is a superb expression of Californian — proof that the state can produce world-class examples of the variety. The nose is instantly expressive and characteristically Grenache, with aromas of violets, tobacco, red raspberries and wet stone. Reminiscent of Chambord, this wine is racy with fresh raspberry confection fruit flavors, supple tannins and a spice laced finish.

text.data: The Qupe Grenache is  a fruity, elegant expression of Grenache which will reward at least five years’ ageing.
To maximize fruit extraction, we used 33% whole clusters in an open-top fermenter and the wine was then aged for 16 months in French oak, 20% new
Grapes for this Grenache were sourced from Santa Barbara County
This Grenache would be the perfect addition to your next wine and cheese party
